title: China bonds rally with yields hitting record lows after PBOC signals more easing to boost growth
content: China bond yields fell to a record low after the People's Bank of China announced that it will cut the reserve requirement ratio on Tuesday.
summary: China bond yields fell to a record low after the People's Bank of China announced that it will cut the reserve requirement ratio on Tuesday.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon warns 'geopolitics is getting worse'
content: The JPMorgan Chase CEO said in an interview with CNBC-TV18 that his "caution is all geopolitics, which may determine the state of the economy."
summary: The JPMorgan Chase CEO said in an interview with CNBC-TV18 that his "caution is all geopolitics, which may determine the state of the economy."

title: China launches probe into Calvin Klein parent over Xinjiang supply chain ‘disruptions’
content: China's Ministry of Commerce said it was launching a probe into Calvin Klein-parent PVH Group over alleged business disruptions involving Xinjiang.
summary: China's Ministry of Commerce said it was launching a probe into Calvin Klein-parent PVH Group over alleged business disruptions involving Xinjiang.

title: China's auto stocks rise unfazed by U.S. proposal to ban Chinese car parts
content: Shares of Chinese automakers climbed in spite of news that the U.S. government is mulling a new proposal to ban Chinese and Russian car parts.
summary: Shares of Chinese automakers climbed in spite of news that the U.S. government is mulling a new proposal to ban Chinese and Russian car parts.

title: Property stocks in Hong Kong rally on mortgage stimulus
content: Hang Seng Mainland Properties Index surged as much as 5% after PBOC Gov. Pan Gongsheng announced several measures on Tuesday.

title: Op-ed: The UK's budget problems date back to the 2008 financial crisis
content: Regardless of how the U.K. fiscal situation stands now, it is clear that the current shortfalls are both years in the making.

title: The unspoken rules of celebrating Oktoberfest in Munich
content: How to order a beer? Which side to tie a dirndl? Here's what to know about celebrating Octoberfest in Munich, the birthplace of the world-famous annual event.

title: Boeing sweetens labor proposal in 'best and final' offer as strike enters second week
content: The new offer includes higher pay raises, reinstated annual bonuses and an increased ratification bonus, among other changes, Boeing said on its website.
summary: The new offer includes higher pay raises, reinstated annual bonuses and an increased ratification bonus, among other changes, Boeing said on its website.

content: We were treated to abundant Fedspeak on Monday. It reinforced narrative the central bank has been on top of its game to ensure a soft landing.

title: Japan is pushing a 4-day working week — but its workaholic culture makes it a hard sell
content: Japan has ramped up its push for companies to adopt a four-day workweek, but those efforts face steep challenges in a country famous for its workaholic culture.
summary: Japan has ramped up its push for companies to adopt a four-day workweek, but those efforts face steep challenges in a country famous for its workaholic culture.

title: Britain's finance minister calls for spending discipline but no return to austerity
content: U.K. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves vowed on Monday that Britain will not return to austerity, saying her budget proposals will look to rebuild the country.
summary: U.K. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves vowed on Monday that Britain will not return to austerity, saying her budget proposals will look to rebuild the country.

title: Gen Z and millennials are increasingly ‘doom spending.' Here's what it is and how to stop it
content: 'Doom spending' is taking off among young people, as life goals such as owning a home or starting a family feel increasingly out of reach.

title: Battery giant Northvolt to cut 25% of workforce in Sweden as part of a major cost-cutting drive
content: Battery maker Northvolt on Monday announced plans to cut a total of 1,600 jobs in Sweden as part of a major cost-cutting drive.
summary: Battery maker Northvolt on Monday announced plans to cut a total of 1,600 jobs in Sweden as part of a major cost-cutting drive.

title: UniCredit boosts its stake in Commerzbank, applies to own up to 29.9% of the German bank
content: UniCredit announced it had increased its stake in German lender Commerzbank to 21% and submitted a request to boost the holding to up to 29.9%.
summary: UniCredit announced it had increased its stake in German lender Commerzbank to 21% and submitted a request to boost the holding to up to 29.9%.

title: Europe careens toward a downturn as its biggest economies fight crises at home

title: China's youth unemployment hits fresh high amid economic slowdown and restrictive hiring policies
content: The jobless rate for people in China ages 16 to 24, and not in school, rose to 18.8% last month. That's up from 17.1% in July, and 13.2% in June.
summary: The jobless rate for people in China ages 16 to 24, and not in school, rose to 18.8% last month. That's up from 17.1% in July, and 13.2% in June.

title: Why EU tariffs are unlikely to dent Chinese EV makers' European expansion
content: To make the European market unattractive for Chinese EV exports, tariffs have to be as high as 50%, according to research group Rhodium.
